sen.j: 大内 教幸（おおうち のりゆき、永享2年（1430年） - 文明 (日本)3年12月26日 (旧暦)（1472年2月5日））は大内氏の一族。
sen.e: Noriyuki Ouchi (1430 - February 05, 1472) was a member of the Ouchi clan.
Noriyuki Ouchi (1430 - February 05, 1472) was a member of the Ouchi clan.
Noriyuki Ouchi (1430 - February 14, 1472) was a member of the Ouchi clan.

tit.cmt: 用語統一リストより、訂正しました。

sen.j: 大内教幸は応仁の乱真っ只中の1470年2月、家督を奪うべく東軍側であった大友親繁や細川勝元と通じて、内藤武盛・仁保盛安、吉見信頼や周布和兼を味方に付け、京都に出陣中であった大内政弘に対し周防国で謀叛を起こした。
sen.e: In February 1470, right in the middle of the Onin War, Noriyuki Ouchi planned a rebellion against Masahiro Ouchi in Suno-no-kuni (currently Yamaguchi Prefecture) who was away fighting in Kyoto at the time, getting on his side people including Takemori Naito, Moriyasu Niho, Nobuyori Yoshimi and Kazukane Suhu, through Chikashige Otomo and Katsumoto Hosokawa of the Eastern alliance which was attacking the family estate.
sen.cmt: 東軍 Eastern alliance, 内藤武盛 Takemori Naito としました。 と通じて は ’を通じて’throughとしました。

In February 1470, right in the middle of the Onin War, Noriyuki OUCHI planned a rebellion against Masahiro OUCHI in Suo no kuni (Suo Prefecture, currently Yamaguchi Prefecture) who was away fighting in Kyoto at the time, getting on his side people including Takemori NAITO, Moriyasu NIHO, Nobuyori YOSHIMI and Kazukane SUFU, through Chikashige OTOMO and Katsumoto HOSOKAWA of the Eastern alliance which was attacking the family estate.
sen.cmt: OUCHI大文字にしました。Suo no kuni (Suo Prefecture, 訂正・補足しました。NAITO, NIHO, YOSHIMI, SUFU, OTOMO, HOSOKAWA大文字にしました。

sen.j: 備後国などを急襲したが、教幸の誘いに乗らなかった周防国留守居役であった若年の陶弘護に敗北を喫し、翌年逃亡先の豊前国馬ヶ岳城で自害した。
sen.e: They attacked Bingo-no-kuni (currently part of Hiroshima Prefecture) however, they were defeated by the young Hiromori Sue, who had the role of caretaker and did not take up Noriyuki's invitation, and the following year Noriyuki committed suicide at his hideout at Buzen Umagatake-jo Castle.

They attacked Bingo-no-kuni (currently part of Hiroshima Prefecture) however, they were defeated by the young Hiromori Sue, who had the role of caretaker and did not take up Noriyuki's invitation, and the following year Noriyuki committed suicide at his hideout at Buzen Umagatake-jo Castle.

They attacked Bingo no kuni (Bingo Province, currently part of Hiroshima Prefecture) however, they were defeated by the young Hiromori SUE, who had the role of rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence) of Suo Prefecture and did not take up Noriyuki's invitation, and the following year Noriyuki committed suicide at his hideout at Umagatake Castle in Buzen Province.
